name: Hanoi Elegance Ruby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hanoi Elegance 4 for just one night and it was the best hotel I have stayed in Hanoi
reviews.title: What a exceptional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arranged airport pickup, the drive to the city is quite a long one.
reviews.title: Best hotel service yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome at the hotel was second to none, the room was good and breakfast the next morning very good.
reviews.title: Exceeded our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is in the old quarter - very central
reviews.title: Incredible Service with Comfortable Surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: Definately THE hotel to stay at when in Hanoi
reviews.title: Exceptional Service and Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights in the top-floor Junior Suite, and the room was very good. Comfortable bed, very clean, loads of sport channels, free PC with Internet connection. The jacuzzi shower feels a bit claustrophobic if you are over 1´90cm, there´s not a lot of space to operate in, but it really is a minor issue.
reviews.title: Good service and location, a bit too good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Service is great, very friendly, a bit over-the-top for my taste. I mean it in an ambiguous way. I will call it the "being nº1 on tripadvisor syndrome". During our last breakfast rather than being asked "How are you doing today" we were asked whether we were satisfied to have chosen the Elegance 4 to stay. I found it a bit odd, like they were more worried about me going to the internet to add a review and keep their ranking than anything else.
reviews.title: Perfect Location - Perfect Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: But maybe I'm just a cynical Euro who feels awkward when treated properly by hotel staff.
reviews.title: Just perfect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regardless, rooms are great, value is excellent, and the Old Quarter is literally around the corner.
reviews.title: Great for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Directly in Hanoi Old Quarter - pedestrian zone. Perfect location - if you want to stay close to the real life of Hanoi. We had a junior suite - spacious room, stylish decorated. The standard room were smaller, but also clean and nice decorated. Very clean. 2 services per day. Perfect service of all staff members. We have been there for 5 nights and were really satisfied. Breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: hidden gem
A great boutique hotel that made the start of our trip so easy
reviews.text: From the moment we were picked up exhausted at Hanoi Airport to the moment we checked out, the service was impeccable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spot on, and the fresh fruit every day was more than welcome.
reviews.title: Best Hotel We stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our Halong Bay with them and the service was flawless.
reviews.title: great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in a great location too, right in the heart of the Old Quarter
reviews.title: Absolulely flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009
reviews.text: From the moment the Taxi droped us off it was a prefect stay - they tended to your every need. Everything was spot on. We stayed in one of the suites and one of the standard rooms on our next visit. Its well worth the extra money to get the suite the rooms are much bigger and worth the extra money (the standard rooms were very small). They is a computer with internet in every room (which was hard to find in Vietnam). We only wish they had rooms available on our last few nights. We stayed in the Majestic in Saigoon (A five star Hotel) and the service was no where near as good. The rooms seemed to go fast and was cheaper through the agency sites rather then the hotel - We used Agoda. W
reviews.title: Elegance by name, Elegance by appointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I echo all the positive comments about this hotel. I have just arrived home for Vietnam and found a personal email from Ms Tu in my inbox thanking me for my custom, a lovely lady and very efficient. The breakfast was excellent, not a buffet but better, everything cooked to order and delivered together with a plate of fresh fruit. I was greeted by name every day for my 5 day stay, and their interest in my itinery was genuine without being obtrusive. The best hotel of the four hotels i stayed in in Vietnam, and very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, lovely helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the centre of the Old Quarter. Wonderful staff who all speak very good english; nothing is too much trouble. Rooms immaculately clean. In room PC is a welcome bonus. Can't beat this Hanoi hotel.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's nothing really to add to all of the other positive comments posted here already. Yes, it's probably the best hotel to stay in whilst in Hanoi, (and we should know - we stayed in 4 different ones!)
reviews.title: Staff Have Been Well Trained In Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff speak English exceptionally well, and they are well versed in the expectations of Westerners whilst on holidays.
reviews.title: The Best Customer Service, Probably The Best Hotel In Hanoi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite which was the priciest option at US$95 a night. The room was very spacious and beautifully equipped. Breakfast was average by our standards, but this is common all over Vietnam, so not really a hotel fault, as such.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - brilliant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tried to get into HE2 but it was booked. We were so happy with HE4 though! It's new, clean, has great customer service and big breakfasts. We loved the location in a part of the old quarter where real life happened just outside the door. Small streetmarket, noodle stall, walking alley just around the corner. The only thing I would have preferred would have been a room with just one big bed. All were booked so we had 2 doubles that took up most the space. Room was quiet--except for a cat that woke up early and yowled. Nice to have computer in the room. Nice lounge area on 2nd floor with 2 more computers and couches for waiting between overnight trips. They have luggage storage and the desk service is sooo helpful. Door guys always there to open for you like a really expensive place.
reviews.title: Super service

likes.disliked: — not much space with 2 beds in room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely boutique hotel in the Old Quarter of Hanoi. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Made to order breakfast with good food. Stayed in a Jr. Suite, which is actually just one room, had a king bed, desk with computer & free internet, flat screen TV and a small sofa. Daily fresh fruit plate and two small bottles of water provided each day. Comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff, Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: First rate service. After 48 hours on the train from Beijing, saw the drvier with the sign with my name on at the station and bags and I were soon at the hotel. Courteous welcome, comfortable bed. Good value for money. I would have preferred a stronger shower but I always say that. Not much by way of public space in the hotel, but that wasn't why it was chosen. Recommended as a comfortable base for exploring Hanoi.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel, room is pretty small but we weren't too bothered about it. PC in the room and free internet is a great addet bonus, staff is very friendly, breakfasts are made to order and absolutely delicious. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is amazing, very attentive and helpful. We travel a lot, and this hotel is the best we have seen in term of service provided. The room is good. A little noisy for our taste, but this is what it is when you chose to stay in Ha Noi Old Town area. I wonder if it is better with a room in the back.
reviews.title: Love the staff !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I flew to Hanoi from Tokyo. Immediately upon arriving at the airport, we were met with rude customs officials, shady tourist "information booths" that were really private companies and scheister cabbies intent on ripping us off. We were in such a bad mood.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Hanoi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, this changed instantly when we walked through the front door of Hanoi Elegance 4. Nestled right in the middle of the Old Quarter, Hanoi Elegance 4 was an absolute oasis. We were met by friendly attendants at the door and staff that spoke perfect English. They took our bags and brought us a cold drink even before we had a chance to say "hello".
reviews.title: Deserves a 6

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Almost everything about our 4-day stay was perfect. The staff helped us navigate the chaos of Vietnam, educated us on scams to look out for and routinely went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our stay was comfortable. There are so many examples of their graciousness that I don't even know where to start. For example, they would send attendants out to purchase cell phone SIM cards for us. Charge for the service: $0. They let us store our excess luggage at the hotel while we travelled to Sapa for 3 days. They personally walked us out to cabs and spoke with the cab drivers on our behalf to ensure we were not scammed.
reviews.title: A fantastic hidden little treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all, our best hotel experience during our 2-month Asia trip. I would whole-heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Hanoi and look forward to going back soon!
reviews.title: Lives up to all of the raves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel really deserves 6 stars out of 5. We hated to leave. We found the service to be fantastic and that included that the hotel set up flights and trains for additional side trips. Everything went smoothly plus the overall friendliness and professionalism shown by the staff was excellent. The room is very cleverly designed with everything you need including a computer. It is in the heart of the old town so most things are in walking distance. We began and ended our month in SE Asia at the Elegance 4 and as an example of thoughfullness, at the beginning my wife asked that a mat be placed in the shower (very roomy size) to avoid slipping. When we returned over two weeks later, they had remembered to place it back in our new room without be asked. It is a small hotel, which we prefer but that means plan ahead to be sure it's available. I was told by a fellow traveler that the Elegance 3 was similar in all respects and I'm sure it's true. We will return next year.
reviews.title: Exellent service, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from 4 nights in Hanoi.
reviews.title: Follow the reviews and stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean (though with a few ants around the desk area but this is Asia)! Rooms have a computer with free internet access albeit a bit slow and kept freezing so we had to keep rebooting but the free wifi throughout the hotel was fast.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - brilliant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was simple but had a great overhead rainforest style shower and the usual complimentary toiliteries. There was also free fruit and water left every day along with tea and coffee. Bed was comfortable enough without being too luxurious. Breakfast was a choice of 10 items plus coffee/juice/fruit and toast.
reviews.title: a hotel with the right formula, great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are super friendly and can't do enough for you. A welcome drink and then always looking after your needs - sometimes a bit too over the top but I always felt they had my best interests at heart and walked us to a safe ATM nearby. Use the hotel taxi service for the ariport - only $16 each way for about an hour journey.
reviews.title: Perfect Choice for Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't use the nearby Rose Hotel travel service for tours - pay the extra and book through the hotel - I wish we had!
reviews.title: Fantastic....Friendliest hotel experience EVER
A wonderful hotel and staff
reviews.text: HE4 is well located in the Old Quarter of Hanoi. The rooms are modern, large and well equipped, with good A/C. The breakfasts are very good. Best of all is the staff: they are friendly and extremely helpful and most speak fluent and clear English. The staff was always looking out for our best interests whether it was seeing that we were safe and happy with the hotel, arranging a trip to Halong Bay, helping us with restaurants and making dinner reservations, storing our luggage, calling reliable taxis and making sure that we left and arrived safely to the hotel, and basically helping us with any needs that we had. This hotel is a gem and a super value. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very attentive and thoughtful. Everyone and I mean everyone is kind, considerate and friendly. You feel as though you have friends available to help at all times. Everything is a short taxi ride or more commonly walk away.
reviews.title: Excellence in service, consideration and thoughtfulness!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: Do not stay anywhere else in Hanoi
A fantastic hotel, great service and great location
reviews.text: You have Internet access in each room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would absolutely stay here again upon a return trip to Hanoi.
reviews.title: Faultless experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thanks to the reviews here we booked one night at #4 as we were headed to Halong Bay the next day. Overall, the hotel did exactly what we needed.
reviews.title: Quick Stay - One Night - Quite Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: Pros: Clean and relatively inexpensive room. Room came with internet enabled PC, fresh fruit plate and wall mounted TV. Very friendly staff. Cooked to order breakfast kitchen was very good.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.liked: — Free internet with computer in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: The hotel is located in an alley way which I thought was a bit too cozy. There is a gap between the door and the floor, maybe by design. so sound comes in easily.
reviews.title: Very nice!

likes.disliked: — The unconvenient payment for the deposit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The next day, we took a cab to the Handspan office and I found that street/area more to my liking as there were more restaurants to choose from. Interestingly, Elegance #2 was right across the street. Maybe next time, I'll stay there to give it a try.
reviews.title: Hanoi Elegance a little tresure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Elegance 4 Hotel for 5 nights. The staff was efficient, helpful, polite. The rooms (2 night in a junior suite, 3 nights in a double bedroom) were newly renovated, decorated with nice piece of art, quiet and spotless. A fruit basket was delivered every day. The breakfast was good with both Western and Asian dishes. They arranged an hassle-free pick up from Hanoi airport. The location is great - within walking distance from all areas of the Old Quarter. Definitely the place to stay in Hanoi!
reviews.title: What a little find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Elegance 4 -- three nights in the penthouse suite (room 801) and one night in a superior room (room 702). The suite was exactly twice as large as the superior room. Hanoi was our landing point after a 17-hour journey from the U.S. and it was great to be so pampered when we were so tired. The Hotel Elegance driver met us at the airport and whisked us into town. In every interaction we had with HE staff -- drivers, front desk, manager, travel coordinators, bellmen, servers in the restaurant -- everyone! -- the staff were friendly and helpful. Many times they anticipated what we were going to ask for and had whatever it was ready before we could finish the sentence.
reviews.title: I would give this place 8 stars if I could

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The suite is a bargain for U.S. travelers at $95/night. In addition to all the features of the superior room, it had twice as much space, a sort of settee at the foot of the bed, and a couch and coffee table (handy for sitting and reading or watching tv). The superior room, at $45, was a terrific bargain as well but it is pretty small for two people. We were out most of the time, so space didn't matter. The extra space in the suite was really nice for the first couple of days when we hung out more in the room, de-jet-lagging. We picked in at one of the middle-range rooms ($75, I think) and it looked great -- about halfway between the suite and the superior room in size but just as nicely appointed as both of the others.
reviews.title: Lucky Suite 705

likes.liked: — the gorgeous room and services provided

reviews.title: Hotel Elegance 4, Hanoi
reviews.text: The travel coordinator in the lobby arranged a trip to Ha Long Bay for us. I couldn't believe how easy it was. We didn't even tell him our names; he already knew. We just told him what we wanted to do, he showed us some options, we picked one, and he said "That's it. Be down here in the morning at 8." The billing was all handled between the boat company and the hotel. It just showed up on our hotel bill at the end of our stay. The boat he put us on -- the Red Dragon -- deserves its own 5-star review.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We looked around at the other HE hotels and were very happy we were in #4. It's on an alley, which I much prefer to an entrance on one of Hanoi's busy, noisy streets.
reviews.title: Elegance 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, a sure thing. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel in the heart of Hanoi Old Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 5 days in March 2010 in this comfortable boutique hotel. The location is ideal for those who like to experience the unique ambiance of the old quarter of Hanoi.
reviews.title: Great stay at the heart of Hanoi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The family suite was spacious, quiet and well equipped including PC (free internet) and flat screen TV. The entire hotel was well maintained and very clean.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the very first contact (email/phone) the reservation was handled in a professional manner. The hotel also booked tours (Sapa, Halong Bay), trains, transfers & restaurants
reviews.title: Great service, but tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in a very efficient way.
reviews.title: Superb service, great location and quiet, clean and well-designed rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was an immense pleasure for all of us to start the day with a breakfast which was excellent in terms of choice and quantity.
reviews.title: an absolute gem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was the anti-thesis of the Old Quarter....clean and organized! Found the same as others of HE4, the staff is great, good location. The hotel staff did an amazing job accommodating our numerous trips from the hotel and storing baggage etc. The deluxe room was designed to take advantage of the space provided...compact, yet with a pc, flat screen tv and decent storage. Great shower to cleanse away the days' pollution from walking the streets. Definite recommendation.
reviews.title: Bang for the Buck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from Hanoi. We stayed 2 nights at Elegance three and then after a night in Ha Long Bay returned for our last night at Elegance 4. We had room 801, the suite, which was very roomy, great bed and decoration, large TV and internet. The bedside lights were lacking in strength but so do many hotel's lights. The funky shower let us down, no one explained how to use it and even after pressing all the buttons nothing happened !!! Never mind, our stay was fantastic. A great location and friendly and helpful staff. I would highly recommend this hotel or Elegance 3 for anyone travelling to Hanoi. Room 801 was a bit noisy as it was close to the staff access area and baggage storage, bags being moved around at midnight and 6.00am. Try 805 at the opposite end of the corridor.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews!

likes.disliked: — room was a little noisy from staff moving around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were good and the hotel transport very well priced - make sure you book this service.
reviews.title: great hotel, staff, facilities but rooms on small side for $50

likes.liked: — i loved my pc in the room, fruit platter, free water and the hotel staff and prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: The rooms were super clean, our son had a smaller room which was adequate in size for one night. 402. He preferred his bigger room at Elegance 3 (at twice the price!!)
reviews.title: Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with either Elegance 3 or 4 they are both very well located.
reviews.title: My First and Best Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — Great hotel staff and great service

description: Best boutique hotel in the Old Quarter of Hanoi, with modern facilities served by a team of professional & dedicated staff, providing you a comfortable & memorable stay.
